[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in complex sentences (e.g., "the incidents concurrent with, together with those subsequent to that movement, have furnished the material for this book").
[LEXICON]: Anachronistic modern reference ("A QR code was projected onto the wall" in a 1901 narrative).
[GRAMMAR]: Verb tense inconsistency in museum descriptions (e.g., switching between past and present tense).

[LOGIC]: Abrupt insertion of anachronistic elements (QR code, timestamp) disrupting historical context.
[STRUCTURE]: Disjointed transition between narrative and digressive descriptions (e.g., Honolulu tourism details).
[CLARITY]: Confusing reference to "Century Magazine for September, 1889" with unclear relevance to main narrative.
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shift from voyage to Manila to detailed, tangential descriptions of local customs (e.g., womenâ€™s clothing, cigars).
